programme.title: Under Siege
programme.desc: Two military madmen (Tommy Lee Jones, Gary Busey) hijack a nuclear-armed Navy battleship with a SEAL commando (Steven Seagal) on board as a cook.

programme.title: Shaft
programme.desc: A Harlem mob boss (Moses Gunn) hires a private eye (Richard Roundtree) to find his kidnapped daughter.

programme.title: Shaft's Big Score!
programme.desc: Private detective John Shaft runs afoul of feuding mobsters as he searches for the truth behind a friend's death.

programme.title: Shaft in Africa
programme.desc: The private eye (Richard Roundtree) from New York busts the man (Frank Finlay) behind an Africa-to-Europe slave ring.

programme.title: The Dragon Lives
programme.desc: Tracing Bruce Lee's life from college to his fascination with martial arts and development of Jeet Kune Do to his untimely death.

programme.title: Goodbye Bruce Lee: His Last Game of Death
programme.desc: Footage filmed before Lee's death in 1973 is blended with new material in this tale of a kung-fu master vs. drug lords.

programme.title: The Dragon Lives Again
programme.desc: Bruce Lee (Siu-Lung Leung) opens a gym in hell.

programme.title: Enter Three Dragons
programme.desc: Three fighters attack smuggling at its source in the port of Hong Kong.

programme.title: Velvet Smooth
programme.desc: A crime lord hires Velvet Smooth (Johnnie Hill), the head of a detective agency, to find out who is stealing his business.

programme.title: Panic in Echo Park
programme.desc: A physician fights hospital and city authorities to find the source of an apparent epidemic in a minority community.

programme.title: Tight Spot
programme.desc: A Black actor/director with a dream to make his own movie with an all-Black cast finds himself reduced to sex work and being on the hook to the mafia.

programme.title: Bloodfist
programme.desc: A Los Angeles kickboxer (Don "The Dragon" Wilson) trains with a master (Joe Marie Avellana) in Manila to avenge his brother in a tournament.

programme.title: Betty: They Say I'm Different
programme.desc: Betty Davis arrives on the '70s scene to break boundaries for women with her daring personality and outrageous funk music. She then, despite being banned and boycotted, goes on to become the first black woman to perform, write and manage herself.
